meanings.definition: To digest again; to undergo a second process of digestion.
meanings.sent1: After eating, the food is redigested in the stomach to extract more nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The cow redigested the grass it had previously consumed.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally redigested the same meal twice, creating a strange culinary experience.
meanings.sent4: Her mind redigested the information, trying to make sense of it all.
meanings.sent5: The book's complex ideas need to be redigested slowly to fully understand them.

meanings.definition: To revise or rework material for publication or presentation.
meanings.sent1: The author redigested his manuscript to improve the flow of the story.
meanings.sent2: She redigested her speech before presenting it to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The student redigested his essay, hoping to catch any errors.
meanings.sent4: The artist redigested his sketches, adding more detail to the final piece.
meanings.sent5: The team redigested the data to ensure accuracy before the meeting.
